website_summaries.verdict: Mat sits at an ideal price point, perfect for someone just starting out with gardening.
pros: Mat comes in reusable storage bag
Germinates most seeds in less than a week
Mat is water and weather resistant
Mat is constructed of 5 layers for added safety
Comes in at a low price point
cons: Edges of mat tend to curl up when nothing is placed on top

customer_reviews.title: More than enough power, so be careful.
customer_reviews.text: TLDR: It seems to be a well made mat, but it's more powerful than the manufacturer indicates. The mat is pretty darn powerful. The description indicates a 10°F to 20°F temperature increase over ampient can be expected, but it's more powerful than that. With the seed tray sitting directly on the mat, the soil temp went from 61°F to 92°F. I ended up raising the tray 3/4" above the mat, and even with the air gap, the tray is staying at 85°F. I may raise the tray a bit higher to get the temps down around 75°F.
customer_reviews.author: MPE

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Heats up well and is a fraction of the cost for a mat at my local big box hardware store. Ordered a second. Plants seem to love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly N

customer_reviews.title: Saves growth time in the garden!
customer_reviews.text: If you are a gardener, you need to invest in this heating mat. I placed bell peppers, eggplants, cauliflower, kale, and collard greens seed starts on the mat, and they all germinated in a week. Recently, I put 8 basil seeds starts on the mat and they germinated in 3 days. This is what I call money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Dancing_Queen17

customer_reviews.title: Use as heating pad for reptile enclosure
customer_reviews.text: Heat mat is perfect for under tank heating for reptile enclosure. It does not have any temperature adjustment, just on/off switch and I found that after constant use the glass on the bottom of the enclosure was too hot, could cause a burn to the animal. But that was without any air flow under the tank. So I raised the tank a little so there is about 1/4" gap at edges of the tank. I think that will do it or may have to raise a bit more. Either way, the pad itself seems sturdy and working as described.
customer_reviews.author: Lynnie

customer_reviews.title: and cucumbers indoors in February to get good, strong
customer_reviews.text: These mats have pole vaulted my seed starting in such a profound way. I am able to start my hot peppers, tomatoes, and cucumbers indoors in February to get good, strong, and tall plants ready for the garden ahead of time. I have been using them for a little over a month, I bought two, and they are plugged in 24 hours a day. My teaspoon tomato seeds were planted on March 3rd, 2017, and they already broke through the top of their soil on March 8th with the help from these warming mats! Would love to buy more when they are in stock again.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for when you can't find a match...
customer_reviews.text: This mat gets VERY hot. Add you can see in the picture, it's over 109°F (it's actually hotter, but my thermometer only goes to 109.9). Most seedlings only need a temp of 70-75° - they don't need to be cooked. Also, don't put it on a wood surface - this thing might be a fire hazard. Really, just don't buy it unless you want to start cactus seeds. Or a fire.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Hansen

customer_reviews.title: My seeds germinated in record time. My wife planted ...
customer_reviews.text: My seeds germinated in record time. My wife planted flower seeds and they sprouted in 3 days. The soil temperature was 15 to 20 degrees higher than the room temperature. I need to order a couple more for my greenhouse.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: *EDITED REVIEW* I'll try it again...
customer_reviews.text: Edit: First mat we received worked one time and quit, I left a 1 star review and company sent me another one, no charge. So, we'll try it again. Revised rating: 1 star for product, 5 stars for customer service= 3 stars. Garbage!!! I used this heat pad under a Jiffy seed starting tray once. ONCE. Now that spring is here and I need to start seeds indoors, when I actually NEED this thing, it doesn't work anymore! It may be a good price, but not if it only works one time, obviously. I really don't know how it received all the glowing reviews, maybe the manufacturer is doing that themselves? Buy something else...
customer_reviews.author: Josey Wales

customer_reviews.title: The magic mat
customer_reviews.text: I was so pleased with my first Ohuhu mat that I have purchased two more. I have started growing orchids and succulent plants that like to have their roots warmed. Shortly after I put my Pheleanopsis orchids on the heating mat they started pushing out new roots and new leaves. This was like magic because they had not put out new roots or leaves while in my care.
customer_reviews.author: IdahoMom

customer_reviews.title: It really heats up nicely and helped our seedings pop right up
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. It really heats up nicely and helped our seedings pop right up. Also I like that it includes growing information on the mat. I have used these kind of mats in a greenhouse before, great for if you don't have a warm spot in the house. It fits a standard size grow tray perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Ren

customer_reviews.title: I am going to have spend more money to get one that works.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to really like this heat mat because of the price. I guess I got what I paid for. The only good thing was it was packaged nicely and arrived on time. I never really felt any real warmth that would make a difference in starting seeds indoors. I barely noticed any temperature change at all. The plants didn't react to it as if there was any warmth coming from it. Plus, what wee bit of heat there was didn't seem to have been evenly spaced out.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely! No muss or fuss
customer_reviews.text: Works nicely! No muss or fuss, it just works. It hasn't fried my plants. As the Spring has warmed up, I put it on a timer to come on only at night. Comes with a nice little fabric case.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for starting seeds, fruit trees and succulents
customer_reviews.text: Arrived when expected and packaged well. Arrived in new, original, unopened packaging. I use heat mats to start my indoor seeds and to grow fruit trees and succulents. All of my plants couldn't be happier! Mats are on 24/7 and temperature is always consistent. Originally, purchased a different brand at a comparable price because Ohuhu was backordered about a week and I didn't want to wait. However, these were sub-par, too hot, burned roots and killed seedlings. Returned and purchased two Ohuhu. Have used for months without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good seedling mat for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This mat does as advertised. When you pick up your pots you can feel the warmth on the bottom. Also seedlings have done better since starting them on the heat mat. Would have been 5 stars but their customer relation skills aren’t the best.
customer_reviews.author: WillyJayTop Contributor: Hydroponics

customer_reviews.title: Broken within a month
customer_reviews.text: This has already completely stopped working. Edit: They sent a replacement, so we shall see if it lasts and I'll update my review. Edit 2: The replacement has stopped working. They have emailed me five times to change my review so I'm taking it back down to one star.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Muse

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 3 days
customer_reviews.text: I received the product quickly. I plugged it in and it started warming. After three days it didn't work any longer. I returned it and bought something reliable. Then, Ada, from their customer service, emailed me repeatedly to not leave negative feedback. I already got my money back, I don't want another defective mat even if it is free, and I don't want other people to make the same mistake!
customer_reviews.author: James Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for kombucha, raised temps nicely!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a recommendation for brewing kombucha. My house is kept in the 68F to 75F range, and as kombucha brewers know the microbes like to be closer to 78. This pad has made the microbes happy, I've got my most active fermentation going after 4 batches. I haven't placed a temperature strip on it yet to see how much it has actually raised it, but I can definitely see happiness in the microbes!
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, no variable controls
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to use with a grow-light to start cacti seedlings. This mat work just as advertised! simply plug it in and you get heat. The heater is warm enough to evaporate water in the green house container I have and thus boost the humidity a lot; the cacti love it. PROs: CONs: - Works as advertised. -No variable controls or settings - Safe (my house hasn't -Short-ish Power Cord burned down) - Comes with a carrying case? -Not sure what to do with the carrying case Overall I would suggest this to a friend that is starting seeds indoors and is on a budget!
customer_reviews.author: Harrison Freese

customer_reviews.title: Suits my needs but not for seeds
customer_reviews.text: I have Raynauds, which is condition of poor circulation in the extremities (hands and feet). I am also a doctor. I keep one on the desk under a calendar blotter which keeps the desk surface very comfortable for my hands. I also have one in the staff area in the basement on the table under a place mat. Amazing how the staff gravitate to that part of the table to eat. I should purchase a temperature regulator as the mat warms up too much at times necessitating my cycling the mat on and off during the day.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Might get too hot for weed seeds
customer_reviews.text: Most places recommend 70-80F (about 21-26C) for weed seeds. This mat will definitely get it above 90F if the ambient room temperature is over 70F. If you're doing rapid rooters, it will get too hot. My suggestion is to either put it on a timer (like the ones you use for your lights) and do half an hour on half an hour off or do a solo cup with soil and place it into another solo cup crooked so the cup sits about 1" above the other cup rather than perfectly fitting into it. If you give it a bit of distance the soil temperature will stay high 70s
customer_reviews.author: Nickolas A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It gets very hot but is durable and will heat with a timer
customer_reviews.text: Without a thermocoupled switch you are going to get your roots about 95-105 degrees in a 75 degree room. My intent was to keep my seedlings at a constant 80 at the roots . This thing cannot do that without a thermocouple switch, and I noticed that the mat does stay hot for a long time even when the switch is off so it may build up a bit more heat depending on the room temp so try to go under a few degrees if tender roots can't hack it.
customer_reviews.author: Photographer AdvocateTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great heat mat
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 of these and two of them are perfect. The other has small defects aesthetically but still appears to work well (longevity?). Open air temp above the mats fluctuates between 75-80F. Put a 1020 tray filled with soil on top of it, I can imagine the temp being closer to 90F. You might consider these products to use in conjunction with: Overall this is a great horticulture/hobbyist heating mat. Pros: Weatherproof Well distributed heat (few hotspots) Cheap Price Cons: Mass production quality (minor aesthetic defects)
customer_reviews.author: Divine9 Studio

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little plant starting heating pad
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use (just plug in) and heats perfectly and consistently. I have no idea what the actual soil temperature is that reaches and for me it doesn't matter -- it makes it warm enough that all my flowers & veggies start quickly and happily in their jiffy pots. And an excellent price when you compare it to the others with a bunch of bells and whistles that you don't really need. The goal is warmer soil and this is what it achieves!
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly fine for seed starting
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. My house is kept on the cold side and I was struggling germinating all my seeds. It only took the heat of this mat and a little patience and I started to see seeds sprout! Be careful, don’t forget to water at least twice a day, the mat won’t roast the seeds but it will definitely dry out the moisture from the seed starter. Note this does not have a way to increase or decrease the temperature. You just plug and that’s all.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Arbelaez

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: Love these, using it as a Pet bed warmer for outdoor animal (11 watts, but when the animal lays on it, it stays about 80-85F, even when it's in the 30's. I put a mat or rug under it to save some heat from going into the cold ground. I also use one to warm my feet under the desk, or on the floor in front of my chair while watching tv late at nite. I have even put it in the bed to warm my feet on cold nites.
customer_reviews.author: Craig R

customer_reviews.title: Great seller and quality products!
customer_reviews.text: great product and great seller! thought my pads were not working well, contacted company, got an immediate response and was told they would replace the pads ASAP. In the meantime I realized that i needed the heating pads on a solid surface instead of the wire/mesh surface with a lot of air flow on both sides of pad. The solid surface fixed my prob, now the pads hold the heat. I am VERY happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: benlove

customer_reviews.title: Not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these. Both worked fine for a while, then one stopped heating. Now neither of them work. I'll purchase a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: JMM

customer_reviews.title: Runs Hot for Me, but A+ Customer Care
customer_reviews.text: This thing runs hot for me. There's no control, so I'm having to keep folded towels between my propagation dome and the heat mat to keep the temp in the dome under 90°F. I am using it to keep seedlings warmer than the 65°F ambient temperature in the room at night. Edit: These folks are very serious about their guarantee of satisfaction. I received an unsolicited email offering a full refund to make up for my rather mild dissatisfaction with the heating pad. Color me impressed.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this, I was concerned about the quality since it was so inexpensive. I was pleasantly surprised when it arrived! The quality is great and it came with a storage bag for when it's not in use. There is no temperature control on this, but I've been running it for several weeks straight and it seems to keep a steady temperature.
customer_reviews.author: rdrupie

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: This year I'm going to start my vegetables from seed so I've been gathering what I need for the Feb start. I know I needed a heating pad of some sort and I had an old heating pad but when I saw this it looked great. Waterproof was the main thing. I got it and it rolls up in a nice storage bag and works wonderfully. Obviously I haven't tried it yet except to make sure it works but it's heavy weight, nice and big enough to fit a couple of seeding trays.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1.5 seasons (or three months after warranty expiration)
customer_reviews.text: Used this for 1.5 seasons starting about ten seedlings each year indoors in a laundry room. Worked fine the first year, and this year, a month into the season, it quit working. Tested on multiple outlets, without a sensor, still dead, Jim. Unhappy. Looking for a different brand of replacement.
customer_reviews.author: GDurb

customer_reviews.title: Quality- not a quality product
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed with this heatmat. I tested it when I received it, but that was only for about 10 minutes to make sure it worked. I’ve only recently put it to use and after only one 18 hour on 6 hour off cycle just one side of it heats. Even the middle doesn’t heat, just one long edge. And I have it on a thermostat and timer. I should have tested it for a longer length of time. Lesson learned. It’s probably to late to do anything about it. I’ll try a different companies product...
customer_reviews.author: D’

customer_reviews.title: Works but Too Stiff
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine, but upon unboxing it is really really stiff rolled up and takes days of a heavy object to hold it down to flatten in order to use for plants. I have other heat mats at a similar price and they are usable out of the box. It's functional so I have kept it... but wouldn't order again.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: too hard
customer_reviews.text: It was rolled up and shipped, and the mat is too hard, not very flexible, so it was hard to get it laid out straight onto the table, had to use some heavy weights to keep it lay flat. Also, the power wire is a little short, had to use extension cord to reach the outlet.
customer_reviews.author: WinWin

customer_reviews.title: Love them .. awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Love these heating mats. While I had originally planned on using them for starting seeds in the basement, I found that they were not doing the job in 53 degree temps. However, after relocating these to a 63 degree room seems to have helped tremendously. The mats feel quite warm to the touch and have done a fantastic job of helping my assortments of flower seeds to germinate.
customer_reviews.author: reefguy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: I had never used seed starter mats before. I'd tried putting trays on tvs, cable boxes, all the things the gardening mags suggest and they didn't seem to do anything. With these mats - cukes, tomatoes, peppers and herbs germinated in 3-5 days. Seriously. And highly recommend this company. I got in touch with them about an issue and they were super responsive. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary Harris

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product, great value...
customer_reviews.text: I like everything like birds and colors and food and sometimes people and laughter and exploring and innovating and designing and mitigating and prototyping and if you're still reading you may just be your due diligence on a level above your average mo-fo, just saying, you earned it..
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ganner

customer_reviews.title: Packaged nicely. Came as expected and had high hopes
customer_reviews.text: Packaged nicely. Came as expected and had high hopes, but overall not worth it. Leaving it plugged in for hours, physical contact with bare skin does not indicate any noticable temp change. No temp change affecting seedling trays or pots. Not sure how this got such high reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Donnelly

customer_reviews.title: ... then it became cooler now doesn't work at all Waste of time and
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok when frist installed then it became cooler now doesn't work at all Waste of time and money they should replace it let you know what happens A customer service person txted me and I was sent a new quick the new one works perfectly nice and hot temperatures are perfect for my baby's I realy appreciate the fast service I will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Kyle wood

customer_reviews.title: Large and no controls
customer_reviews.text: Most economical option for plants and sprouting. Overheated the sprouts first time used, so takes some adjustments to the spacing and so on to get it right. Still the better options than other ones on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolai

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite heat mat
customer_reviews.text: Not my favorite heat mat. I barely noticed any difference in temperature when it’s plugged in. I also don’t really like that there is no temperature control. It’s relatively inexpensive but you pay for what you get in this instance.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: QUESTIONABLE
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof so far. Great jumpstart for my seedlings :UPDATE: It shutting off by itself now with minimal heat coming off of it I have only had it less than a month
customer_reviews.author: ronald kiser

customer_reviews.title: Don't cook my roots
customer_reviews.text: The mat is well packaged and well made. I is sturdy and waterproof so far. I have it for some very delicate seeds. It does as it says, it will bring the temp about 15 degrees above the ambient temperature. This is bit high for my liking so I used some corrugated plastic coroplast sheets to help keep the temp under control.
customer_reviews.author: Martin De La Plum

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working.
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be working well. I don’t have a high low thermometer or any type of thermometer for that matter. I don’t understand how they advertise that it’s waterproof but the instructions tell you to keep it dry. I’ve only been using it for 3 weeks. I do notice an increase in root growth perhaps.
customer_reviews.author: Janice L. Glaser

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: It was a little tricky to set up as the plastic is such good quality that it's difficult to unfold and keep flat but once it heated up and I placed some weights on the sides, it laid flat just fine. I purchased two mats for my seedlings and they are starting to sprout nicely! Would definitely recommend these mats as they're easy to clean and maintain consistent temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof and works consistently well
customer_reviews.text: A simple product that does what it says it is supposed to do: provide heat for seedlings. I tried growing some seeds without a heat mat, and none came up, and with the heat mat over half came up when I tried again. Other factors were involved with growing these seeds but having the waterproof heating mat made a huge difference.
customer_reviews.author: Lwjkjr

customer_reviews.title: Basic Needs
customer_reviews.text: Does what the basic task calls for, warming soil. Temperature can’t be adjusted or read. Heats up rather quickly. Not to hot to touch but enough to warm a couple pots. Made of plastic/rubber like material and thin. But I do like the STORAGE BAG!!
customer_reviews.author: Tiera

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This may really bumped up my propagation game. Cuttings in soil root so much faster with added heat. I have no idea what temp it is, and it doesn't have controls, but the plants seem to like it
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany C.

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: Cooked my pepper seeds. Would have been better off with store bought heating pad. If your house is warm don't use. Too much heat! My pad must have been defective and they gave me a full refund. I am satisfied. May buy another one next year.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Too hot
customer_reviews.text: This thing gets too hot. I am trying to germinate spinach in a window well that has an ambient temp of 55 to 60 deg F. I want my seed bed 75 deg F or less. This runs the seed bed temp up to 85+. That's too hot. I have tried to prop the seed bed up 1.5" from it but it still keeps it too hot. I didn't really want to get carried away with an additional thermostat control.
customer_reviews.author: JT in Kansas

customer_reviews.title: Great but gets hot
customer_reviews.text: Im am a first time seed starter and i set ny pad up on a desk under a grow light. On my first round I set my pad up with my seeds but nothing germinated. I checked the temperature and it was at 108 degrees. I did some research and many people recommend putting a towel or cardboard on the pad to reduce the temperature. For most seeds you want a temperature between 75-85. With the resuduced temperatures I started new seeds and it work great!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very simple and easy to use. Just plug it in and the mat produces a nice even warmth. Wish there was a temp control, but for this price and simplicity it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to start my garden in the winter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with a digital control and it works great! Made it much easier to start my garden in January/February so my plants will be a good size by the time I plant them in my garden in March/April.
customer_reviews.author: MLM

customer_reviews.title: I was bad at clones now im good at clones
customer_reviews.text: My clones were always dying. I had humidity dome tried rockwool and rapid rooters. Humidity was good... As it turns out asside from having moist cubes the single most important factor is root temp. BUY THIS WITH A CONTROLLER! 100percent success fast very fast..
customer_reviews.author: Privacy is nice

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Pay the 2 bucks more doesn’t put out hear like others and they don’t mention don’t get wet at all garbage buy anyone but this one. A rare negeative review for me useless
customer_reviews.author: RHebs

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to, very happy!
customer_reviews.text: This worked amazing! Helped my seeds sprout so fast and couldnt be happier . Made my growing of flowers and veggies much more enjoyable and faster .
customer_reviews.author: werd

customer_reviews.title: Helped start my seedlings in Feb
customer_reviews.text: So far this heating pad works fine for me. Based on some comments that it can overheat, I do put a towel between the pad and the tray. Allows me to start seeds in February in our cold region.
customer_reviews.author: Mavis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a second heat mat for a snake enclosure and regret not just going with one of these initially. It heats a large area quickly and efficiently. I definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Chipped Polish

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work as good as others
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job just barely done but it is NOT NEARLY as good as my vivo one. I should’ve just stuck with what I like but wanted to save a couple extra $. Not worth it. Spend the extra few $!! The farthest side from the plug is cold. So the last 1/3 of the mat barely even heats up and not at all at the end.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Need help from seller
customer_reviews.text: This stopped working in 22 days I need new ;(
customer_reviews.author: yuliya borovskiy

customer_reviews.title: Adds gentle heat to bottom of cuttings/seedlings.
customer_reviews.text: Just started using on some valuable fig cuttings. It seems to produce gentle heat and if it continues to work I'll upgrade rating to 5 stars. No thermostatic control, but for the price that's understandable.
customer_reviews.author: A J Berke

customer_reviews.title: Worked only one season
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine the first season when it was on for 7 weeks. Unfortunately only 2 weeks in to the second season, about 20% at one end is slightly warm and the rest has no heat at all. I've dropped this to 2 stars because it did work as expected at first. But it has now become a one and done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warmth is where it’s at.
customer_reviews.text: It was as advertised. I use it to help my seeds develop. The storage bag will be useful late than summer. Then again maybe not. Overall,for the price much better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Charlo V.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I’m so impressed with this product that I have reordered twice. They work well, temp control seems even and plant starts do well and they are easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good  product
customer_reviews.text: This heating pad for my seeds was so much cheaper than my old one from several years ago. I was a little leary, but was NOT disappointed!. It comes rolled up, but unrolls once heated up. It is heating my planted seeds up very nicely. I will buy this product again .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Correction
customer_reviews.text: I retract my previous review. The pad is working and function satisfactorily. Pad does not get very hot, but probably that is expected so that it does not overheat and cause problems. Keeps tray warm with plants.
customer_reviews.author: SHPOPS

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for Ohuhu!
customer_reviews.text: This is a better pad than the other brand [ipower] I've tried. Firm pad, even heat, NO PLASTIC ODOR, sealed and waterproof, nice carry bag, earns all 5 stars on all accounts.
customer_reviews.author: Tryitagain

customer_reviews.title: Great heat mat for starting seeds
customer_reviews.text: This is a very large heat mat, and it’s great. You can fit multiple trays on one. I bought one and liked it so much I bought two more.
customer_reviews.author: Alohahoneypie

customer_reviews.title: Got my plants off to a great start.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second mat I've gotten for my plants for the winter. Works great. My sun-room can get pretty cold in the winter and this mat keeps them from suffering from the night drop in temperature. Definitely a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Helen H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect heat mat for brewing Kombucha
customer_reviews.text: Bought this heat mat to brew kombucha. Works great with my ceramic crock. Keeps it about 75-82 degrees perfect for kombuch. This size mat is great because it can fit 2 crocks side by side on it.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Cold in spots
customer_reviews.text: It's not that warm, warm in spots cold in other places on the mat. I got it for my orchids for bottom heat in the winter time and the other type of heat mat I purchase you can dramatically tell a heat difference with the pots.
customer_reviews.author: opierce

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot. It comes rolled so I have to keep it under something heavy to try to straighten it out. If that didn’t happen, I’d give it a 5 star
customer_reviews.author: Heather K

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I used this with some indoor led grow lights and a plastic green house. These are radishes after 3 days (they sprouted after 1.) Nice and warm!
customer_reviews.author: M. Chomer

customer_reviews.title: Very warm.
customer_reviews.text: Really, there is no heat control. Insulating pads or cardboard can't stop the heat. A few flat pieces of wood and sheets of wood so there is open air space does work. Adjust as needed. I was getting 120 degrees on a 75 degree day. Adjusted to get 80 or 85 degrees spouted my kangkong seeds in one day! I'm glad to have it for those other stubborn seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, safe and effective
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would’ve purchased this sooner after wasting months trying to get kombucha to ferment in cool temperatures. It’s been plugged and working perfectly for weeks. No overheating or poor distribution of heat. Would definitely buy again if I needed another one.
customer_reviews.author: Room2GrowGarden

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Keeps seedlings nice and warm. ~10° above ambient, as advertised. No temperature control needed, really.
customer_reviews.author: Yuri Brodovitch

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: Mild heat. Worked very well; best seedling production I have yet had, in terms of the seeds growing, not getting too leggy, etc. no adjustments possible to temp, just plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: D Darkman

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a 3 flat cold frame.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product for use in my cold frame for starting seedlings and it has worked well beyond my expectations. I have found no need for the temperature control that can be added, so my suggestion would be save the money to start with and see how it works for you. Make sure that when you get it you kay it out flat and weight it for a day before you try to use, it tends to want to roll up if not.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal Reason

customer_reviews.title: Safely boost greenhouse (tray) sprouts
customer_reviews.text: This heat may for the bigger sized plastic greenhouse trays is awesome. Feels well-made and is clearly safe to leave on. I had seeds in for four days with no action; put this under and they popped up in a day.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. O.

customer_reviews.title: Used this then bought a heating pad..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and it works but doesn’t put out much heat.. Plus there’s no way to control any amount of heat so I searched Amazon for a better heating mat for my seedlings. I couldn’t find one any better so I opted in buying a regular heating pad( one you’d use on your back) for my seed germination and discovered that it works so much better, is much cheaper and has built in control for heat..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy plants!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for seedlings and also on cool nights for my more sensitive indoor plants. I would buy it again. Great little heat mat.
customer_reviews.author: YukonGirl

customer_reviews.title: Worked great to jump start my seedlings.
customer_reviews.text: Used this under the Jiffy professional greenhouse to start my hot pepper plants. It kept them just warm enough to get them to sprout quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrold B. Toy

customer_reviews.title: Easy and effective
customer_reviews.text: I use this to keep chili pepper plants at the proper soil temperature. Set it and forget it. Super easy and subtle in the table. Added bonus that it’s water proof. My little spills don’t damage the table top.
customer_reviews.author: David K. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: used under a 4 foot feral cat bed box.
customer_reviews.text: It stays warm and we have a thermal fleece blanket covering it, during the coldest nights works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: MeandMy Baby

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: We put our freshly planted seedlings on the day I received it and within 24 hours we had our first sprouts. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: rhi1982

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: It has a bag! Wow makes storing for next season all the easier.
customer_reviews.author: Lind Lindstrand

customer_reviews.title: Great and long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and I have ones going for well over a year without being turned off
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heats unevenly
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's ok but there is no temperature control and it gets very uneven. Hot and cold spots
customer_reviews.author: Lee~Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: No temperature control area just plugs in. Does what it needs to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian2020

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: It might get a little too warm sometimes but otherwise, it's a good heating pad
customer_reviews.author: Аmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This mat work great for sprouting our seeds. We had also used it for our new chicks to keep them warm. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon St. George

customer_reviews.title: Must have for early start
customer_reviews.text: What ever did I do with out this. This little thing is awesome my seedlings love it
customer_reviews.author: D.M.

customer_reviews.title: It be what it be for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough for the price. Heat is uneven as it will dry your seedling in the middle and is lacking towards the edges. Its above meh. Yet... Meh.
customer_reviews.author: Javia Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: It works, but I had to throw it out afterwards
customer_reviews.text: Helped my seeds germinate, but melted the plastic nursery. Had to throw the mat out because it cracked all over and had melted plastic stuck to it.
customer_reviews.author: Staci

customer_reviews.title: Working great for 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Use for 3 months per year and do not take the best care of the item. Keeps the pots very warm even when it is cold; however the pots are in a lidless ice chest
customer_reviews.author: HWS

customer_reviews.title: Product works great for seedlings and regular vegetation
customer_reviews.text: Like the size of this product great for seedlings and great for cold days in the house keeps bottom of plants warm sitting on ground
customer_reviews.author: Cryptalien

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't Wait
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to finally receive (on time). Description reads 10-20 degrees. Placed pad under clone dome and it seems to be more on the hot side. Can't tell yet.
customer_reviews.author: SoSarah

customer_reviews.title: 100 degrees is too hot
customer_reviews.text: This seed map is too hot. Digital thermometer says it's 100 degrees and my tray of sprouts that I put on it died from over cooking. I should have spent the extra money for a more reputable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: BUY WITH CONFIDENCE!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product with an exceptional prompted customer service. Buy with confidence that its proudly backed by seller.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Warm seeds are happy seedlings.
customer_reviews.text: umm, why didn't someone tell me that a small heating pad would sprout my seedlings so much more quickly? Seriously, using this thing increased germination time and rates on all my seedlings. Totally worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Maddux

product_meta.title: Ohuhu Seedling Heat Mat, MET Standard IP67 Waterproof Seed Starting Plant Heating Pad, 18W Hydroponic Heating Mat For Indoor Seedling And Germination, 10" X 20.75", Bonus A Storage Bag
feature_bullets: STABLE HEATING SYSTEM: Designed to increase the temperature of the rooting area 10℉ to 20℉ above the ambient air temperature, perfect for indoor gardening, for better plant growth and flower seed germination

WATERPROOF & EASY TO CLEAN: IP67 water-resistant, proofed against splashes, showers and sprays. Due to the high waterproof level, it is easy to clean this Ohuhu plant heat mat, just need to rinse and wipe it
DURABLE & HIGH QUALITY: Made with heavy duty PVC material which is corrosion resistant, insulative, firm and durable
LARGE SIZE: The size of this Ohuhu seedling heat mat is 10” x 20.75”, larger than average size of others, suitable for general seed germination
CARRYING POUCH: Comes with a storage bag, just need to roll up the heating pad and put into the handy carrying bag when not in use, convenient for collection

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars639 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
